Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
At its price point (I paid <$80), this printer offers a very strong set of features, all of which appear to be functioning well (after two weeks of use): - Wireless connection was easy to set up. - ePrint works very well. I sent the first job from my iPhone and the printer started the job within 10 seconds. - Double-sided print works well. - Photo size section of the feed tray is very convenient, a nice feature for a printer at this price. - Single-color inks are a selling point for me.
Additionally, I was pleased with the performance. - Adequate print speed - Very high photo quality
I could not give this printer five stars on performance for two reasons. First, it is the noisiest ink printer I have ever owned. Second, it typically takes about 15-20 se ... conds for start-up.
Overall, the value at a low price knocks this back to the 5-star rating. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: So far so good. Easy setup, quality prints.
Item.Review:
Pros: Setup, features, design.
Cons: Paper capacity, noise
This was my first experience using a wireless printer. Setup was easy and painless. It connected to my router automatically, all I had to enter was the password. The computers, 1 XP and 1 Vista, installed the software and connected to the printer as they should. A feature I like is there are 2 trays for paper ... 1 for photo paper up to 5x7 and the other for standard letter or legal size. No changing from one to the other. The downside of this arrangement is that it doesn't hold much of either. The photo prints are good quality using HP ink and HP paper. Documents are good using plain paper. Yes, it's a bit noisy, but in my house, it's in a separate room from where we live so it's no big deal. I have not used the epri ... nt feature yet, but I set it up easily. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Great printer at a GREAT PRICE!!!
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Reliable; Quiet; Great Print Quality; Compact Design; Easy To Set Up
I have been in need of a printer for quite some time now. I am a full time student, work from home in an office, and I also do photography on the side. So my needs for a printer were something that could print beautiful photos while at the same time, scan, make copies, and print excellent quality documents. This printer does that all for me. I wasn't expecting this level of performance from a printer that is so affordable, but it is truly worth every penny and more. The setup was a breeze and the interface is well thought out and there's no second guessing about where you need to look in order to find what you are looking for, as far as the options go. Even when I hit a few bumps along the setup ... process, the install process was prepared for any and all dilemmas, making them solvable in about 15 seconds. The interface even offers instruction videos, showing you how to perform different functions and even put the ink in. My friend spent over 300 dollars on her "state of the art" all-in-one printer, but has consistently been using mine since I bought it. Even the scanning on this printer is amazing. It's quick, quite, compact, and affordable. I will definitely be sticking to HP printers in the future, and definitely be recommending this printer to my friends and family. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: So very simple to set up!
Cons: No film negative scanning.
Wow, how lucky can you get? I've only bought four printers in 26yrs. A Brother daisy wheel for 2 yrs. A Panasonic dot-matrix for 4yrs. I had a LexMark inkjet for 8 yrs. By far the best printer I've had to date, the HP Photosmart 3210 All-In-One, the print head screwed up, after 12yrs. I'm replacing the HP 3210 with this printer. I can only hope I get another 12 yrs out of the HP 6510.
I have heard others have problems setting up their HP 6510. Hmmm...don't know what their problem is, but I just plugged it in and followed the Quick Setup steps.
It took maybe 15-20 mins max, including update download, to set this printer up. The printer linked up with my wireless network immediately upon completion o ... f setup. As for the problems other people have had setting it up, maybe they jumped the gun and didn't follow the steps or didn't download the update.
I can't comment on the ink consumption as of yet. I did about 30 pictures on testing and didn't see much ink use. The quality of picture is good to excellent. I did noticed a difference (contrast) between screen and print quality, but still prints nice pictures. Will have to look into see what can be done to match What You See Is What You Get (WYSIWYG).
Printing speed is excellent. Quality of print is too. Love the Apps capability on the touch screen. They can be added and deleted to fit you needs. Plenty of apps to choose from the website. Daily Shoduku, Crosswords, Recipes, etc. can be printed automatically. NICE!
The only thing I really didn't like about this printer, FOR ME, is that printers today no longer come with film negative scanning (computer assessory). So I'm keeping my 3210 just for this purpose. Thank heaven for DSL photography!
Overall, I am pleased with this printer. Thanks HP for another great product! expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
I did research on the internet before purchasing this printer, and the printer overall has exceeded my expectations. This is the fourth HP printer I have purchased since I began using personal computers and the only brand I have used.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
My HP PhotoSmart 6510 Printer is perhaps the best printer that I could have ever purchased and in my opinion is the best printer that you can buy for the price. Setup over my home WiFi Network and installation of drivers was a flawless and quick experience, and now eprint works when I need it, where I need it. It even has help and support directly from the printer, which is an excellent touch, so that the hassle of logging on and searching the internet for help is virtually eliminated.
The 3.45'' touchscreen display shows a crisp, clean picture and is ultra responsive. Even if you have large fingers like myself or small fingers like some of my friends, the screen is easy to navigate and requires no double-taps what-so-ever. From that screen, you can directly access your Snapfish acc ... ount or use and download a TON of apps for the printer.
Speaking of Apps, this printer has just about everything built into it already that you'd need! From recipes, to coloring pages and even notebook paper all ready for print. I find the HP Forms app specifically useful seeing as how one can never have too much notebook paper. While on the subject of consumption, the Photosmart 6510 is SUPER ink efficient, it's like its already paid for itself only after the first month of use. Even when it runs out, the instructions clearly state the exact type of ink required and the price of HP Ink is super affordable as opposed to some other brands of ink.
Lastly, loading paper into the printer is the fastest and smoothest process ever! Loading plain paper is as simple as opening the pack, pulling a number of sheets out, placing them in the tray, and then sliding the paper holders against the sides of the sheets. I personally print using a lot of envelopes, and this printer eliminated the hassle of trying to get the door open on the envelope slot on my previous printer. All I have to do is place the envelope straight in, and then slide the holders to where they grip it snugly. The second tray for ... expand » « collapse

Being able to take a photo or download a document on my smartphone and then print directly to this printer is amazing. ALso, the separate paper tray is a godsend or otherwise you'd have to unload regular paper first before printing photos. Great value and product.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Great upgrade from old Canon printer
Item.Review:
Pros: 1. Really great print quality, especially black. Looks dang near laser print quality even at normal quality settings on basic paper
2. Prints pretty fast
3. LCD touch is real gem of printer. Its screen is easy, simple and kinda fun to use, well laid out menu's and easily configurable. Every printer should have one of these.
4. Few photo prints i've done on quality, glossy photo paper look real good
5. Scan quality is good all around, though im not much of a scanner, works for my basic needs
6. Prints pretty fast even from a cold start
7. Not that bad noise wise.
8. Duplex printing is so freaking nice
9. Wireless easy as pie to set up via LCD screen
Cons: 1. Cartridges can get expensive but of course, thats been the case ... forall inkjets for the last 10 years. Spend a little extra and get XL sized cartridges to get more value for your money and print jobs
2. Paper tray holder a bit small, only 80 sheets max.
3. Photo paper tray really flimsy feeling
4. If printer isn't on a solid surface, it will rock back and forth during printing, messing up print quality.
5. Scanner sure is noisy
6. Scanner lid can't be raised for books and such
Was forced to retire my well aged canon ip3500 printer after it gave up the ghost. Been wanting an all in one printer with a scanner for those rare times I need it and wanting duplex printing for work documentation. Personally, I didn't need fax or automatic document feeder and I knew this model couldn't do it, so I'm not gonna dock it for that. I do wish HP would strop reaming on on cartridge pricing and amount of ink they carry, its like a freaking conspiracy and its getting old but Canon, Epson and Lexmark are no better either. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: Very nice printer for the money
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use
Cons: Paper tray does not hold many sheets
I have had this printer for almost a month now and use it mainly for printing & scanning documents. However, it does a great job on pictures as well. I love the larger touchpad for easy application. It is very easy to use. There are only 3 things I would change... 1) I wish it would have a larger paper tray 2) a tray for continuous scanning (as opposed to just the flat bed) and 3) a faster ppm. However, for the price and size, it does a great job (as well as all the other HP printers I have had in the past). I would highly recommend this product.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.ReviewTitle: price was great for the features
Item.Review:
I bought this product at staples in July,2012. I like the features for the price, wireless printing. The initial set up didn't take long, just put the cd in the sw takes over. The install went ok on vista pc, but I didn't notice any HP printer icons on the desk top but I printed a test page ok. I installed the sw on a XP pc which has the linksys sw on it and the printer sw came installed a printer with network designation. I was able to print. then a few days later I losing ability to connect w/ the printer. I could not turn off the printer by the on /off button. I had to unplug the printer to get the connections up. I also reinstalled the sw on the vista pc and this time the hp icons show up on the desktop.
I have not contacted hp tech support on th ... is yet, because I don't do a lot of printing and thought the problems could be caused by the G speed router.
I went to the review section and saw a comment the printer doesn't come out of the sleep mode. It seems that i have the same problem. expand » « collapse

This is my third HP ink-jet printer. The other two, printers only, lasted about 4 to 5 years before abruptly quitting. HP now seems only to be marketing "all-in-one" (print-scan-copy) machines, a redundancy for me, since my workhorse is a laser "all-in-one". I use it infrequently, mostly for photos, those silly Christmas newsletters, and the occasional church project. In terms of setup and ease of use, this one seems to be the best of all, and it produces good quality work.
The Staples employee who explained the machine to me was very well trained and knew what she was talking about. All in all, a pleasant experience.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: I needed to replace an older Epson printer because ink cartridges were becoming scarce. At the time time I wanted a 3-in-one to replace an ancient Epson scanner that was not supported by any decent OCR programs. After much research, I settled on the 6501 and I've been really delighted so far. It's totally cool to look at, of course, but it works beautifully as well. For my home printing needs, the output speed is fine, and I love the duplexing (except in the Print dialogue box on my iMac, I have to keep clicking that it's okay to use "Long-Edged Binding" on US Letter paper!). Oh, and I also love that I can do double-sided copying! The LCD screen is easy to use, and the on-screen animations made inserting ink and fixing a paper jam hassle-free. I don't print photos, so I can't judge how the ... y'd look, but the colors and black text on the documents i do print are rich and clear. The scanner software could offer a few more options, but it's simple to use and gets the job done. I'm surprised there's no OCR feature at all in the scanner, but I use ABBYY FineReader anyway because my text scanning is complex and FineReader gets along well with the printer's scanner driver. I haven't used up an ink cartridge yet so I don't know how many pages I'll get out of one, but from what I researched the ink use seems more or less average for this type of printer. Overall, I'm genuinely enjoying this product! expand » « collapse

Colors images and (and HP's sample photo on the provided photo paper) looks good (and better than my Dell printer). For replacement ink, I bought a set of XL cartridges. Item.ReviewTitle: Great value for what you get

We are a heavy wifi use house. 4 iTouches, iPad, 2 iPhones, desktop PC, Toshiba laptop, Accer netbook, Xbox. I was worried about interferance at times but have not seen a thing to this point. Prints all the time, every time. The thing I like the most is you can put it anywhere. It doesn't need to be the traditional way of parked next to the desktop. Just needs signal. The print quaility is great for our needs. Mostly for school use and some work items (spreadsheets). For the price this one is easy.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
I bought this printer to replace an HP c309a. For the price I paid ($109), I find this printer to be an adequate substitute.
Advantages: 1. The wireless ePrint features are handy. I especially like being able to send the printer an email for printing (email and attachments). 2. The cleaning cycle is MUCH shorter than on the c309a. Waiting for the old c309a to finish grinding through its cleaning cycle after every print job was a pain. 3. The 6510 is much lighter than the c309a. 4. Printing speed is about the same, as far as I can tell.
Disadvantages: 1. No feeder tray for multi-page copying or scanning. 2. 6510 does not accept the old size of the XL printing cartridges (they are too wide). 3. The 6510 does not take the Photo Black ink cartridges either. T ... hat's a shame as a I have three of them left over from the old c309a. 4. The 6510 does not print CD labels. 5. No Bluetooth connectivity. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: The pictures are very clear BUT you can only use HP brand photo paper :( With my old HP printer I was able to use different brands of photo paper. I tested a few pictures with Canon photo paper and the ink was smearing all over! I bought this because my old HP printer gave out after 5 years. My old HP was alot easier to use then this one. I was on the phone with customer service for nearly an hour trying to figure out why my 4x6 photo tray was not working after the sample print. He couldn't figure out why it wasn't printing, after hanging up with him I adjusted a few things in my control panel. Shipping to Alaska, I waited nearly a month for this printer to arrive. I'd order a new printer but I wouldn't want to wait another month! And another thing, my memory card reader wasn't working ... either :( expand » « collapse

Item.Review:

Cons: Noisy; Paper loading constricted; Hard Setup; Scanning problematic
Can't scan from unit, only from laptop. HP acknowledges this problem but has no fix yet. Paper loading is tight; unit very noisy on start up; EPrinting is fine; copying is fine. Inks easy to load. Touchscreen directions okay but not intuitive. I wanted the C310 but it was out of stock; this is an upgraded item. I was an Epson user for 20+ years until my all-in one died after 2.5 years. Their tech support was awful. HP has wonderful tech support but the product isn't great.

I love to print from my iphone and ipad and I love the double sided printing.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: wireless printing, ePrint feature, automatic duplex printing, easy setup
Cons: need to know how to setup duplex printing on mac to work
I was looking for a double sided printer. After trying a Canon, I upgraded to this one. It's very easy to set up. If you're a mac user and are looking to use the double-sided printing feature check: In the print window that pops up after you select File>Print, select Paper Handling. Click in the check box to select "Scale to fit paper size". That allows you to select the Destination Paper Size. Select from the pull-down menu US Letter, then US Letter Two-sided margins. Now when you go to Two-sided Printing, you can click on the check box to select Print Both Sides.

Also, it's noisy. Not a quiet printer.
Otherwise it'd be great. The e-print feature is pretty nice. It was really easy to setup.

Item.ReviewTitle: So far is a great product
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set up
Purchased a HP D110 photosmart in the last yr and had a few issues getting the wireless going but got it there. Was looking to replace an old HP deskjet model. Bought the HP 3052A at WalMart for $49. Spent 5 hours trying to get wireless to work. Spent 90 minutes on the phone with HP tech support. Finally concluded if the wireless was not being recognized the only method to problem solve was to touch an actual router. I was using a WiFi card for wireless. Taking it back and came to Best Buy to buy this unit. Connected first time using wireless (without needing cable from printer to computer for setup). Only took about 30 minutes to get up and going totally including registering with HP. Like the fact this unit has a separate tray to hold photo paper that 3052 and D1 ... 10 do not. So far has been great and definitely recommend for wireless printing and setup. Iphone and Ipad recognized the printer with no set up required on those devices. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Wireless and easy to use.
Cons: Haven't been able to get Air Print to work.
I primarily use my printer for a quick copy or for complete hundreds of pages long documents every now and again to send off for evaluation by agents. I upgraded to this printer for the automatic two sided printing feature for the most part. Lowers my costs and saves me time having to monitor a print job to turn a stack of pages and reinsert to print the other side. I often just printed single side because it was easier. I don't have to do that anymore. More economical on ink than previous printer as well, which was the second goal.
It's not a really fast printer, but then again it doesn't really need to be in my application. It just needs to get through print jobs reliably. It does respo ... nd to a print job sent over the network quickly, very little delay if any.
Air Print doesn't work with any of the apps that I use. Tried every tip or set of directions I can find, most of them horribly outdated. Even HPs tech support didn't seem to have up to date information on the topic. They kept referring to steps that couldn't possibly be for this model printer. expand » « collapse

I can not print directly from my Hallmark Card program. Big bummer! After 3 hours with HP support (I commend them for the time they spent trying to help!) they could not resolve the issue. They told me they would call me back within a few days and never did call back....not good follow thru. But, other than envelopes this is a really nice machine!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice features in theory. Easy setup and connection to wireless or USB (tried both). Local touch screen easy to navigate. Average color printing.
Cons: MAJOR - will not print 4x6 from the 4x6 photo paper tray from the computer (Win 7) - prints the 4x6 onto the letter tray instead. At least four other customers on HP site complained of same problem since Jan 2012, and still no fix from HP. Other problems - I did an download update from HP site, and it locked up computer and killed the Win boot. Hand to do Win repair and disconnect and remove printer from computer to boot. Noisy, lots of grunting and bells from local touch screen. Returned to store (BB) for refund.
Check out HP customer site before you buy. Can't believe the good reviews here and at BB. I wonder how many r ... eviewers actually tried printing 4x6 from the photo tray from computer. expand » « collapse

This printer took 8 hours to install - 2 1/2 hours with the hp chatroom technician. It printed 2 sheets of black and white a minute not 11, used up all the colored ink on two trial sheets for alignment, had no directions in English to follow, and printed every 8th page 2 inches lower on the page (the 8.5X11 inch paper does not stay in place). I would return it, but it was too much of a hassle to set up the first time. The CD for installation did not work - had to use the hp web site. Programmed for borderless photos and they came out with borders. Nothing good to say about it at this time.

Has toner saver mode and paper saver mode with 2-sided copies. Expect to save money over time with ink replacement. Has a ten second warm-up time for the first copy, but then it spits out remaining copies quickly. Have worked around the no mobile e-print capability with an app for printing through my wi-fi network.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States

I love this printer.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States

Seems to last a long time for me and I really like that the colors are separate cartridges so I can replace what I need to-no waste. The cartridges are also very affordable.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States

The scanner works well, an important feature for me. I sort of miss the old HP Solution Center and wish that the new printer was recognized. At least all the features are still there utilizing the current printer icon.
Design is good looking. The touchscreen is a convenient feature and a good step up from the old printer. I do wish, however, that the printer was quieter. Not as loud as the old one, but still noisy during print setup.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: In theory, it works with Apple's Air print... if you can get it set up.
Cons: Wireless connectivity is a joke.
For the price, the 6510 seems like a great printer. It has all the features one could ask for. We ended up returning the printer twice, and getting an Epson WorkForce 845 on the second return (three visits to the store altogether).
Why? Setup for wireless is impossible.
While I was able to install the printer via USB cable, it simply would not get recognized on my wireless network. Even using the latest drivers from the HP Website, as well as the latest HP Drivers for Mac OS X 10.7 from Apple; the printer claimed during setup that it was connected to my wireless network, but could never be found, even by pinging it's IP address. I tried setup in W ... indows 7 and Mac OS X 10.7 and both failed to recognize the printer on my network. HP's forums are rife with similar complaints.
I like to pride myself in my ability to fix pretty much any issue I've been faced with dealing with technology. However, this experience with HP has soured my perception.
On the other hand, I've never had problems with Epson printers. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: multiple cartriges. saves ink

I'm replacing an older printer that used only 1 cartrige (color). I was looking for multiple cartriges to conserve on ink. I am updating to wireless also. I wanted the capability to print photos, but I predominantly print black and white documents. I like the simple touch screen. I can print right from my sdhc card, I can even print from my back yard. I printed my first photos recently and was amazed at how clear they are. The colors are true to form. Printing a document is pretty fast, the photos take a bit of time. For me that's fine. I'm pleased with this printer. It meets my needs perfectly.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Handy, intuitive features, good quality, good value
Cons: Printing might be a bit slow for a huge stack, but otherwise nothing
My wife and I were looking for a printer/scanner that would handle the random documents we print out, produce good quality pictures, and also serve as a scanner to save/email documents that we only have hard copies of. After looking at reviews online and comparing prices and features, we decided to go with this HP. We've been very pleased!
Set up was remarkably quick, even the surprisingly handy wireless network feature that allows us to print from our laptop or iPhone on the other side of the house. Photos have been excellent in quality, and scanning is a breeze. We haven't used the HP ePrint feature, but I'm sure some folks would find i ... t helpful. If you are looking for something for a small business, this might not have the speed you'd get for twice the price - but for home, it's quick and reliable. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: I had a C309g Photosmart Premium all in one printer which I have had for 2 or 3 years and it was a great printer especially printing photograph. I had to replace it as I apparently shorted it out with a static spark when turning on the printer . Fortunately HP had a sale on the 6510 which was the closest printer I could find to replace the C309g. The big difference is the 6510 uses on;ly four cartridges and does not have the extra Photo Black cartridge. This will save money but I am not sure the photo printing will be as good. The 6510 is smaller, lighter and faster than the C309g. It also appears to be a little cheaper plastic so it isn't as workhorse as the C309g but then again that one shorted out after 2 years. The printer was super easy to set up with wifi to the desktop and laptop. T ... he ability to print remotely is pretty cool as are the apps but that seems like more of a gimmick. Overall I think it is a great little printer and at $109 (on sale) it was a super buy and HP shipped it to me in two days with free shipping. WOW! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set up, cheap, ePrint, compact
Cons: ink is kind of expensive... but so is all ink on the market.
The Good:
Size: So I have always wanted a printer with fax on it just for the top-loading copier, but never picked one up because they are so huge and bulky. Not this one. The 7510 is just about as compact as my last generation HP photosmart without fax.
Screen: The screen size is another upgrade from my last HP, which why would this be a big deal? How often are you actually playing with the screen on a printer? Well when you do the large-touch-friendly screen simple to navigate on.
Set-up: I stated on my review for my last HP printer that it was the easiest set-up I’ve ever used. HP did not change a thing, and the process was made even simpler wit ... h the touchscreen on this one that my last one lacked. And right when it is connected to my wi/fi all my iOS devices are connected.
The photo-paper tray: I don’t do a lot of photo-printing at home, but now that I can just hit print and not have to run over to the printer and change paper and any settings, I have been doing it a lot more lately.
Quality: Print quality on documents is great, but that has kind have reached its apex a few years ago. Photos are really good, still not as good as some of the professional series Epson’s but it is $300 cheaper, and you probably won’t see the difference between the 7510’s and Walgreens’ prints. Scan Quality is fantastic also, and is a fast transfer.
ePrint: Not a huge plus since just about all HPs over $79 have this feature now, along with most other printer companies coming out with their own type, but it is still an amazing and needed feature. Plus how often do people want to fax things anymore? Hardly ever. And it is ridiculous that you need a separate phone line if you do it often… but now with eFax it faxes over the internet. You get 20 free faxes a month without a phone line, which is way more than enough for 99% of the population now, but if you do it more than 20 times you can upgrade to 150 or 200 incoming and outgoing for less than a phone line price.
Not-so-great: ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: I bought this printer a few weeks and love it. It was a breeze to set up and use right out of the box. The touch screen was so easy to follow I didn't need to read any instructions. Being wireless is just the cherry on top....the cost of maintaining it is my favorite thing! My Lexmark printer was killing me with the cost of ink. Yesterday I bought 2 black cartridges (1-250 pgs & 1-550 pgs), one of each color cartridge (300 pgs ea) and 85 sheets of 4x6 photo paper for the same price as one black Lexmark cartridge! I'm sold! Thanks for a great product HP!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact Design
Cons: Too much ink used; Unreliable; Jams Easily
After 2 months of use, the printer will only print in red. I have spent hours on the phone with HP Tech Support. Their solution is to unplug it, plug it in, unplug it, plug it in. They finally offered to send me a replacement print head - except that the print head is not replacable. I have had HP printers for many years and overlooked minor irritations, but after this experience, I will not buy another HP printer.

Item.ReviewTitle: I hope this one is better than the other
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Fast Print Time; Compact Design; Easy To Use
This is my 4th HP (various models) in 3 years. Something went wrong with everyone of them, just past the 1 year mark.,however, it's cheaper to buy a new one rather than have the old one repaired. Getting a machine with the same ink supply is a task, but you need to salvage something. If this one goes in a year, it will probably be my last HP

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: I bought this printer 2 months ago and have already spent a lot of time on the phone troubleshooting with tech support. My only complaint in the first 2 months was the ink consumption. The ink suggestions in the specs are nowhere near accurate. In 2 months I have printed approximately 400 pages with an average amount of text and few pictures, and have used the starter cartridges plus a second cartridge of each of the colors and 2 additional XLBlack cartridges. I have printed 1 photo and I was very pleased with the quality of the photo printing, but overall, I do regret having purchased this printer.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Set up & ease of use. More than just a printer - great value.
Cons: There's very little to nothing to dislike. Honestly.
This really is a very nice product and seriously ticks all of what I consider the essential first needs, at least for the majority us, (Value, Price, Appearance, Quality, and Performance). There are a multitude of wireless printers out there at a multitude of prices, but if you’re looking for a home or office printer that won’t break the bank, will go from box to print ready in minutes, and provide very good image quality, then this one could well be right for you. It will also tell you what to have for dinner, but read on for how that works ! Above all else it’s seriously, seriously good value, and so easy to use.
When I opened the box and ... saw just how much thought had gone into the packaging, I knew things were going to go the right way. A product that lifts straight out of the center of the box simply by grabbing hold of the handles of a nice cloth type protective bag, with the rest of the product accessories and protective materials neatly package around it. Best packaging on PC accessory products I’ve seen yet.
Very quick and easy set up with a one page simple instruction sheet, and an even simpler screen touch display that are both so easy to follow I watched my teenage kids do it. It was set up, sourced and connected to wireless very easily, and very quickly. It really couldn’t have been easier to be honest.
I replaced a slightly older and pretty expensive non-wireless printer with this HP 6510 wireless in a home office environment, and in every respect the print quality was far superior, especially 6x4 photo prints. In fact I printed photographs that my daughter had recently paid to have printed at a photo print outlet, and the improvement was striking, which I find pretty amazing given the price point of this printer. I printed photographs straight from a camera memory card which inserts into a very handy card port at the front of the printer. I also synced my iphone and ipad to this printer and printed documents and photos directly to the printer using ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up on a wireless network
Cons: A little noisy while printing.
After using this printer for over a week, here are my first impressions:
1. Very easy to set up for wireless printing. I own another wireless printer, and this was easier to set up. It grabbed my home network settings and added itself to the network. No cable needed (there is no USB cable included). We have three PCs in our home, 2 running Windows 7 and one running XP. I had no problem installing the driver and software on any of them. 2. There’s an LCD touchscreen on the front of this printer, which makes some of its functions very user-friendly. What I most like about it is the how-to animations that step you through the basics: installing new cartridges, adding paper and photo paper, ... and helping with initial setup. 3. One of the functions I really like on the 6510 is the duplex feature (2-sided printing). It’s effortless and fast. No paper jams. 4. The scanner on the 6510 is quite good and I am impressed with the quality of the scans (I’ve already had one of my scanned photos professionally framed). 5. Photo printing is also very high quality. I printed a number of family photos and the quality is as good as photo-kiosk printing, and suitable for framing.
There are some interesting features on the 6510 which I haven’t yet used – the ePrint feature, which allows you to print photos and documents from any web-connected PC, a smartphone, or tablet. Also, “Print Apps” (“a shortcut to printing content from the Web directly from your printer, with no computer required”). Print Apps are accessed through the touchscreen on the 6510. Your printer must be web-connected in order to use these apps. The Google Docs app sounds interesting and I’ll be trying that soon.
HP’s website and support pages are helpful and filled with detailed answers to common questions. I used the “How Do I?” link to learn to print envelopes.
The only issue I’ve had so far is that I was unable to make the 6510 print a custom-sized envelope using Microsoft Word 2010.
So far, I like this printer a ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 6510 e-All-in-One B211a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner - English, French, Spanish / Canada, United States
Item.Review: This was easy to set up following the get started pamplet. I set mine up through the router instead of connecting it to the PC. It prints fast. On some systems you will have to tell it each time in the preferences to print double sided. One of my systems is that way, three do it automaticlly. I found one thing that was hard to figure out. If you want print pictures on your 4X6 photo paper, and the picture is on your computer or phone already, you must first upload it to an album on Snapfish. Nothing that I found said that. The one thing I dont like is trying to print index cards (also 4X6) when I load them in the paper tray, it is really hard to get the left over paper out of ther tray. It will not come out far enogh to get hold of them. I finally had to use a pencil eraser to pull them ba ... ck far enough that I could get hold of them. Prints great from my Iphone, Ipad, Vista laptop, and Windows 7 desktop. The email and print from anywhere, even when not at home is a really nice feature. expand » « collapse
